title: Conquer Your Studies: Strategic Battle Plan study dashboard

requirements.summary: Create app shell and primary navigation with two main areas: War Map dashboard and Divide and Conquer tasks.
acceptanceCriteria: App header displays the full app name exactly as provided.
There are two clearly accessible primary sections/pages: Dashboard (War Map) and Divide and Conquer.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create the root app shell layout with header (showing the exact app name), primary navigation links/tabs for the two sections, and a main content area that switches between the Dashboard (War Map) and Divide and Conquer views. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., navigation, buttons, cards) to compose the shell UI; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Dashboard (War Map) page component and export it for use by the App shell. Use shadcn-ui layout primitives (e.g., Card) to keep styling consistent; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Divide and Conquer page component and export it for use by the App shell. Use shadcn-ui form/list primitives (e.g., Button, Input, Card) for consistent interaction UI; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure the root render remains wired to the App shell and React Query provider; verify App imports resolve to the created frontend/src/App.tsx and that navigation between the two primary sections is functional.

requirements.summary: Apply a bold/adventurous Strategic Battle Plan theme and enforce the Red/Blue/Green/Yellow status color system with consistent labels.
acceptanceCriteria: Each of the four statuses is visually distinguishable and consistently mapped to the specified color and label (Mission Critical / Tactical Drills / Victory Zone / Scouting).
Theme is applied consistently across pages (buttons, cards, badges, headers) and reads as bold/adventurous (not minimal/neutral).

file_operations.description: Create global styles and CSS variables to support a bold/adventurous Strategic Battle Plan theme (typography, spacing, background treatment) and define semantic tokens for the four strategic zones. Ensure global styling applies across all pages without editing immutable component files.

Extend Tailwind theme with named colors (and/or CSS variable mappings) for the four strategic zones and any additional theme tokens needed (e.g., banner/background overlays) to keep styling consistent across the app.

Add a shared mapping utility that converts backend Status values into UI labels (Mission Critical / Tactical Drills / Victory Zone / Scouting) and corresponding Tailwind classnames/tokens so every page uses the same color+label logic.

Create a reusable StatusBadge component that renders the correct label and color styling using the shared status mapping. Compose shadcn-ui components (e.g., Badge) if available to keep consistent look-and-feel; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Build the War Map syllabus dashboard UI showing map-like nodes/territories with color-coded status labels.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard renders a collection of syllabus items in a map-like layout (nodes/tiles connected or arranged as territories).
Each syllabus item shows its title and current status label and color.
User can visually scan the map and identify which items are Scouting/Mission Critical/Tactical Drills/Victory Zone by color and label.

file_operations.description: Implement the War Map layout: render syllabus items as map-like territory nodes/tiles (e.g., grid/flow layout with connecting lines/paths), show each itemâ€™s title/topic and StatusBadge, and apply Strategic Battle Plan styling. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card) for nodes and consistent spacing; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create React Query hooks to load syllabus items from the Internet Computer backend interface (getAllSyllabusItems) using the existing core-infrastructure backend connection patterns. Ensure hooks expose loading/error states and caching appropriate for the Dashboard UI.

Create a reusable node/territory component used by the dashboard to render a syllabus item with title, optional description, and StatusBadge, styled to look like a map territory. Compose shadcn-ui primitives (e.g., Card) where appropriate; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement Divide and Conquer UI for creating chapters/topics and tasks, updating task completion/status, and persisting changes via backend calls with React Query.
acceptanceCriteria: User can create a chapter/topic and add multiple smaller tasks under it.
User can mark tasks complete and see completion reflected in the UI (including Victory Zone color/label where applicable).
Edits (create/update/complete) persist after page refresh (not purely in-memory).

file_operations.description: Implement Divide and Conquer flow: (1) create a syllabus item (chapter/topic/description), (2) select an existing syllabus item, (3) add multiple tasks to the selected item, (4) update task status (including Victory Zone for completed tasks). Render task lists with clear status labels/colors using StatusBadge/status mapping. Use shadcn-ui form and list components (e.g., Input, Button, Card) to compose the UI; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create React Query mutations for createSyllabusItem, addTaskToSyllabusItem, and updateTaskStatus, including cache invalidation/refetch for the syllabus item lists/details so changes persist and are reflected after refresh.

Create a task list component that displays tasks for the selected syllabus item, includes controls to mark a task completed (Victory Zone) or change status, and uses the shared status mapping for consistent labels/colors. Compose shadcn-ui primitives (e.g., Button, Dropdown/Menu if available) for interactions; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a selector component to choose a syllabus chapter/topic from loaded items (and optionally filter/search). Compose shadcn-ui components (e.g., Select/Popover/Command if available) to provide an accessible selection UI; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Display the provided motivational quote as a prominent closing section at the end of a primary page/flow.
acceptanceCriteria: The quote text appears exactly as provided (including punctuation and dash).
Quote is placed at the end of the interface/flow (visually bottom-most closing section on at least one main page).

file_operations.description: Create a prominent closing-section component that renders the quote text exactly as provided and styles it consistently with the bold/adventurous theme (e.g., banner/card treatment). Compose shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card) where useful; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Place the MotivationalQuote component at the bottom of the Dashboard page content so it is the closing section of the primary flow and visually bottom-most.

requirements.summary: Add required generated static art assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and visibly use at least one in the app shell or dashboard.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are stored under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
At least one generated background/hero image is visibly used in the app shell or dashboard without breaking readability.
No backend endpoints are used to fetch these static images.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static background image asset at the required path for direct frontend use (no backend fetching).
Add the generated static icon set image asset at the required path for direct frontend use (no backend fetching).
Add the generated static header banner image asset at the required path for direct frontend use (no backend fetching).

Wire generated art assets into the app shell (e.g., render the wide header banner and/or emblem area) and ensure readability with appropriate overlay/contrast from the theme. Reference images directly from frontend/public/assets/generated (no backend fetching). Use shadcn-ui layout primitives as needed; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Apply the parchment-style war map background texture on the Dashboard (or its container) and optionally use the icon set for legend/status indicators, ensuring map readability. Reference images directly from frontend/public/assets/generated (no backend fetching). Use shadcn-ui components where helpful; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
